author: _pablop
content:
Hey guys, is there any reason why we are using the OIDC provider in the siwe flow? why canâ€™t we just use the direct auth flow in our case?

- The UX problem I see when using the OIDC approach is that we will need to force the user to connect his wallet again to do the contribution. And we will need to verify that he is using the same wallet. Is this flow something that we have already decided to follow?
- If we use a direct auth flow with our backend (https://kzg-ceremony-sequencer-dev.fly.dev) we could have more control and we could request the user to connect just once

author: bridge-bot
content: <CarlBeek> combining them would definitely smooth out the flow & makes a lot of sense from a UX perspective. the major down side is forcing participant implementations to keep the entropy around longer (although the primary website already does that) & of course needing to implement that in the sequencer now that it is already in audit.

author: _pablop
content:
Got it, thanks.

So, given that we need to connect the user again to do the contribution, I think we should implement the same web3modal that the OIDC provider is using (which is https://github.com/spruceid/siwe-web3modal) in order to give the user the possibility to connect to the same wallet he used before. Right now we are just allowing them to connect to MM in this step
